org.deventropy.junithelper.derby

Class DerbyResourceConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deventropy.junithelper.derby.DerbyResourceConfig

  • public class DerbyResourceConfig
extends Object
    Configurations to control the EmbeddedDerbyResource.

    This class provides a fluid interface to build the config object to pass to the constructor of the resource. Example usage: 

     EmbeddedDerbyResource derbyResource = new EmbeddedDerbyResource(
                DerbyResourceConfig.buildDefault().);

    Some methods in this class, for example the methods setting the subSubProtocol, can be mutually exclusive and unset / alter values set by other methods. Certain configuration values have valid values as null and do not have corresponding getDefaultXXX methods.

    Author:
    Bindul Bhowmik

    • Method Detail

      • buildDefault

        public static DerbyResourceConfig buildDefault()
        Sets up a default config that can be used as is to start a database. See the appropriate getDefaultXXX methods to see the default values.
        Returns:
        A config setup with defaults.

      • getJarDatabaseJarFile

        public String getJarDatabaseJarFile()
        Returns the Jar database jar file path. Right now only used for the :jar: protocol for the jar file. Returns the file path of the jar file with the read only database.
        Returns:
        The jar file path
        See Also:
        useJarSubSubProtocol(String, String), Accessing a read-only database in a zip/jar file

      • getDatabasePath

        public String getDatabasePath()
        Returns the name/path of the database to use. This is a multi purpose field; it is used as the end of the JDBC URL.
        • For a memory database, it is the database name;
        • For a directory, it is the absolute / relative directory path;
        • For a jar database, it is the path of the database inside the jar file;

        Consult the documentation for Derby Sub Sub Protocols on database name formats and use.

        Returns:
        The database name.
        See Also:
        getDefaultDatabasePathName(), Syntax of db connection URLs

      • getDefaultDatabasePathName

        public static String getDefaultDatabasePathName()
        Returns the default database name value, which is a UUID string.
        Returns:
        The default database name.

      • useInMemoryDatabase

        public DerbyResourceConfig useInMemoryDatabase()
        Will have the database start up as an in-memory database with a database name generated using getDefaultDatabasePathName().
        Returns:
        This instance

      • useInMemoryDatabase

        public DerbyResourceConfig useInMemoryDatabase(String databaseName)
        Will have the database start up as an in-memory database with the specified database name.
        Parameters:
        databaseName - The name of the database
        Returns:
        This instance

      • useDatabaseInDirectory

        public DerbyResourceConfig useDatabaseInDirectory()
        Use the :directory: Derby sub sub protocol. The database will be created in a directory named with the getDefaultDatabasePathName() as the directory name.
        Returns:
        This instance

      • useDatabaseInDirectory

        public DerbyResourceConfig useDatabaseInDirectory(String directorpyDbPath)
        Use the :directory: Derby sub sub protocol, with the database in the specified directorpyDbPath. The path is either relative or absolute as interpreted by the Derby engine.
        Parameters:
        directorpyDbPath - The relative or absolute path where the database is created.
        Returns:
        This instance

      • useJarSubSubProtocol

        public DerbyResourceConfig useJarSubSubProtocol(String jarFilePath,
                                                String dbPath)
        Use the :jar: Derby sub sub protocol. The jar file containing the read only database is a relative or absolute path in jarFilePath and the database path in the dbPath parameter. The jarFilePath is either relative or absolute as interpreted by the Derby engine.

        For more format information see Accessing a read-only database in a zip/jar file

        Parameters:
        jarFilePath - The relative or absolute path where the jar file with the read-only database.
        dbPath - The path of the database inside the jar file.
        Returns:
        This instance

      • getSubSubProtocol

        public JdbcDerbySubSubProtocol getSubSubProtocol()
        The JDBC sub-sub protocol to use for the embedded database.
        Returns:
        A valid Derby sub-sub protocol

      • getDefaultSubSubProtocol

        public static JdbcDerbySubSubProtocol getDefaultSubSubProtocol()
        The default sub-sub protocol value.
        Returns:
        JdbcDerbySubSubProtocol.Memory

      • getPostInitScripts

        public List<String> getPostInitScripts()
        Gets the configured post init scripts in the config; or an empty list.
        Returns:
        Post init scripts to execute

      • addPostInitScript

        public DerbyResourceConfig addPostInitScript(String postInitScript)
        Adds a post init script to the config.

        A post init script should refer to a file containing SQL DDL or DML statements that will be executed against the new derby instance. Script locations can be on the classpath or file system or on a HTTP(s) location, for format, see UrlResourceUtil.

        Parameters:
        postInitScript - A post init script to add
        Returns:
        this object
